author: Rfranks08
title: AI Proposal Evaluation and Guidance
description: We're relying on humans to critique an ever growing set of proposals; how can AI provide higher quality feedback and improve results

assessments.note: I think this proposal directly addresses the challenge in that it attempts to reduce the human time element involved in governance as well as expand on capabilities seemingly within the community's reach.

I find the idea of integrating (altho a little bit skeptic) AI to help assorting with the increasingly higher amount of information. But as to where it should give recommendations I disagree because the idea of Cardano is decentralization, I believe in that and I don't think we should look for big shortcuts when it comes to hard work. Being efficient yes but to use one central point of AI (to chew the food for us) takes a lot out of the process of going from idea to proposal to being reviewed and accepted for voting that is required from the community/humans.

I can see this helping separate ideas that require more information for proper assessments or as an assisted step to improve the quality of proposals at the early stage. This proposal could help streamline the process and provide feedback to the proposer in real time. There are certain proposal that could work with other proposal create a more robust strategy and to be mixed into one team that can deliver more quality and performance to both. The proposal addresses the challenge posed.

An AI can provide unbiased feedback. However, it does lack the 'human touch'. So, while this might help us tremendously, I envision an ideal situation where there would be a symbiosis between the human insight element and the AI. In other words: both are needed to maximise efficiency.

This proposal is addressing a very important topic: How to reduce complexity when working through all the current (and future) Catalyst proposals. Would be good, if there can be a cooperation found with e.g. the 'Great Filter' proposal under this campaign. This definitely looks to me like a move into the right direction.
Proposal aims to create an AI algorithm that would evaluate proposals as a helping tool for voters.

The problem and solution presented are reasonable, but as the challenge is focused on solutions in the short term, we need to stick to the deliverables for Fund4 and these deliverables are subjective and incomprehensible, I recommend that the description be more objective so that we can understand if the proposal will have relevance in the challenge.

train AI to critique proposals and give recommendations,
1) AI personal consultant medical data
2) AI personal trainer diet
3) AI track of basis daily financial record
4) AI voice recorded and translate to any native
      language.
5) AI detection virus or bug to auto fix
6) AI protect encryption wallet address ,Public
    address.
An interesting idea, pert for as an academic case study, not for here. The focus should be on engaging the community to review and discuss proposals, not build an AI to replace them

I was not particularly satisfied with the proposers answer to the question about his experience in this field. I also felt that it would have been prudent to reach out to some people (which ones can be fairly easy to search) within IOG and Singularity in order to begin a dialogue along these lines, learn, and therefore provide the community with a little more of a feel for what would be needed in terms of time as well as the likelihood of any potential collaboration with IOG and/or Singularity personnel.

As to a feasible plan, all I have to say is that,  what is given as information on the step by step process is left a little bit in the air. On how work would be done step by step. I for one would like more information on how this proposal could take place. It has potential but doesn't come more than an idea at the moment.

The proposer reveals an abundance of experience in the matter and present clear deliverables in the proposition. The solutions appear to be of a great start to improving the standards already in place. Perhaps to work as a form of assistance to community advisor or to be the first round of assess stage and then gets handed to human community advisor for further review.

There is need for a plan on how to implement this proposal in the current system. A staged roadmap would solve this issue.
Proposer's experience is very relevant for the proposal.

The definition of done of this proposal is to deliver a vision, a strategy, requirement specifications  and a tangible roadmap to get this AI support tool forward. I do think that the team with their listed qualifications can do this. Unexpected complexity may arise from finally deciding if this should be built further. I strongly propose to join forces with similar proposals (like the 'Great Filter' team).
Team of two people with plenty of experience in building systems. Plan is well presented, although there is no cost breakdown in the proposal.

Given the complexity of the solution, I believe that a more detailed plan is needed so that we can understand how the AI model could help in a practical way in decision making. The proposer described relevant experiences for the proposal, but there are no details on the professional experience and qualifications of the proposer/team, I recommend including more details and links to Linkedin and Github, if possible.
is great idea but it needs to deep learning lots of data to input
There is no detailed plan, KPI or budget breakdown presented. It's not clear what experience the proposer has in applying IA (no examples of previous work)

As noted in the previous assessment note, it does not feel as if any great level of due diligence in information gathering was performed for this proposal and so I do not feel as if this proposal provided sufficient information on its feasibility. It is a rather good idea that needs quite some more information gathering and planning done before it can realistically have its feasibility assessed.

I mean for my level of knowledge I think this proposal for the potential it has. It is very lacking. It is interesting but it's lacking a lot of planning and guidance of where or how it is going to be structured. I think it should've been better explained for newcomers and people of different fields of study.

The proposal presents deliverable metrics and a detailed plan that can be used as a roadmap to success. More information may be required to give voters the confidence that it can be deployed at a specified timeframe and assurances that it can be as an assistant to community advisors and not a replacement of thereof.

It is unclear as to which AI would be used to perform this. Would it be an implementation of an already existing AI system or would one be built?
The cost might exceed 10000 USD for a project this size, which is ok as the ROI would be great as well. Consider a recalculation asking for more.

A proper risk assessment is missing in the proposal. What if the AI assesses a funding round erroronous?

Based on the deliverables, I guess that success or no-success will be decided in a next round of Catalyst. I suppose that the team will present their achievements and ask for funding for developing the tool. Sounds like a good plan to me, provided all potential synergies and cooperation potential with other proposals are utilized.

While I agree that the proposal is feasible and doable, I would like to see more operational details in the plan on how the team will tackle this. A more detailed timeline would be helpful, as well as a cost breakdown.

There is no roadmap, milestones, KPIs, deliverables are incomprehensible, I recommend that they be described more clearly. A budget breakdown has not been described and there are no details on the qualifications of the proposers.

It is not clear whether the deliverables presented will be relevant to the challenge.
likely if all stand out ,if it more content regarding the interface of the project or any protocol

The AI method which would be used to achieve this is not detailed, not any examples where something similar has been done. There is a lot of literature on AI methods and applications, but nothing is referenced, not even a Wikipedia page.

solution:
build data sets about ideas and projects
train AI to critique proposals and give recommendations
experience:
Me: AI & Data Strategy Consultant @ Big 4 firm; 12 years experience building systems
1x Support: has AI & data strategy experience
